```{r import and reset button}
# daily covid19 statistics per day per country
import("https://www.ecdc.europa.eu/sites/default/files/documents/COVID-19-geographic-disbtribution-worldwide.xlsx") -> covid19

# file with population number per country. to be trimmed
import("r_pop_per_country_over_time.xls") %>%
  slice(4:268) %>%
  select(country=1, country_code=2, pop=63) %>%
  drop_na() %>%
  mutate(pop = as.numeric(pop)) -> world_pop

# reset for a clean start
keep(covid19, world_pop, sure = TRUE)
```


```{r daily covid19 cases per country, top_X displayed}
text <- 10
last_date <- covid19$dateRep[1]
topnumber <- 10

# cases
covid19 %>%
  filter(dateRep %in% (last_date)) %>%
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% unique(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  top_n(topnumber, cases) %>%
  select(countriesAndTerritories) -> top10cases
list_countries_top10cases <- top10cases[['countriesAndTerritories']]

covid19 %>%
  select(dateRep, cases, deaths, countriesAndTerritories) %>%
  mutate(country = as.factor(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  select(dateRep, country, cases, deaths) %>%
  filter(country %in% list_countries_top10cases) %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = dateRep, y = cases, fill = country, color=country)) +
   geom_line() +
   geom_point() +
   theme_cowplot(text) + ylab("cases per day") + xlab("time")  -> cases


# deaths
covid19 %>%
  filter(dateRep %in% (last_date)) %>%
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% unique(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  top_n(topnumber, deaths) %>%
  select(countriesAndTerritories) -> top10deaths
list_countries_top10cases <- top10deaths[['countriesAndTerritories']]

covid19 %>%
  select(dateRep, cases, deaths, countriesAndTerritories) %>%
  mutate(country = as.factor(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  select(dateRep, country, cases, deaths) %>%
  filter(country %in% list_countries_top10cases) %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = dateRep, y = deaths, fill = country, color=country)) +
   geom_line() +
   geom_point() +
   theme_cowplot(text) + ylab("deaths per day") + xlab("time") -> deaths

summary <- plot_grid(cases, deaths, nrow = 1)
cases
deaths
```

# settings
text <- 10
last_date <- covid19$dateRep[1]
topnumber <- 10

covid19 %>%
  arrange(countriesAndTerritories, dateRep) -> covid19_sorted # dates are reorder and ready for cumsum

# finding the top countries
covid19_sorted %>%
  filter(dateRep %in% (last_date)) %>%
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% unique(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  top_n(topnumber, cases) %>%
  select(countriesAndTerritories) -> topcases

covid19_sorted %>%
  filter(dateRep %in% (last_date)) %>%
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% unique(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  top_n(topnumber, deaths) %>%
  select(countriesAndTerritories) -> topdeaths

# finding top countries by cumulative sum and relative to total population
covid19_sorted$cumsumcase <- ave(covid19_sorted$cases, covid19_sorted$countriesAndTerritories, FUN=cumsum)
covid19_sorted$cumsumdeath <- ave(covid19_sorted$deaths, covid19_sorted$countriesAndTerritories, FUN=cumsum)

covid19_sorted

covid19_sorted %>%
  mutate(casepm = (1000000*((cumsumcase)/(popData2018)))) %>%
  filter(dateRep %in% (last_date)) %>%
  filter(popData2018 > 1000000) %>% #
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% unique(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  top_n(topnumber, casepm) %>%
  select(countriesAndTerritories) -> topcasepm

covid19_sorted %>%
  mutate(deathpm = (1000000*((cumsumdeath)/(popData2018)))) %>%
  filter(dateRep %in% (last_date)) %>%
  filter(popData2018 > 1000000) %>% #
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% unique(countriesAndTerritories)) %>%
  top_n(topnumber, deathpm) %>%
  select(countriesAndTerritories) -> topdeathpm

list_countries_topcasepm <- topcasepm[['countriesAndTerritories']]
list_countries_topdeathpm <- topdeathpm[['countriesAndTerritories']]



covid19_sorted %>%
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% list_countries_topcasepm) %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = dateRep, y = cumsumcase, fill = countriesAndTerritories, color=countriesAndTerritories)) +
   geom_line() +
   geom_point() +
   theme_cowplot(text) + ylab("cumulative cases norm. per total pop.") + xlab("time")


covid19_sorted %>%
  filter(countriesAndTerritories %in% list_countries_topdeathpm) %>%
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = dateRep, y = cumsumdeath, fill = countriesAndTerritories, color=countriesAndTerritories)) +
   geom_line() +
   geom_point() +
   theme_cowplot(text) + ylab("cumulative deaths norm. per total pop.") + xlab("time")
